messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: working for the city, was animals
messages.msgSnippet: That brought back memories.  When I went to work for the city where we use to live I found out all kinds of things I wished I didn t know!  And became a
messages.messageBody:
That brought back memories. When I went to work for the city where we use
to live I found out all kinds of things I wished I didn't know! And became
a storehouse of useless information in the process! Anyone want to know how
many fire engine reds there are <g>

Lynda, who processed the bid for a new fire engine and now knows all kinds
of weird things about fire engines.

----- Original Message -----
From: <SandraDodd@...>
>
> No, you're okay---
>
> Not IN the water, but in the spaces around the pipes, in the tunnels,
between
> pipes. Manholes.
>
> Not all cities, but Albuquerque.
>
> It's gross, and I temped for the city once coordinating something related,
> being a dispatcher for the full-time anti-cockroach brigade, which is why
I
> know more than I wish I knew!!
>
> I think in some big, old apartment buildings they just live in the
buildings.
> I've always lived in detached houses and usually had cats.
>
> Sandra
>
